Articles.Content: i was looking at a topographic map of kerbin, and i was interested in the north and south pole because i was looking for a place to test my rocket powered rovers for a land speed record. on the map they seem relatively flat but i have never been to either so i dont know. are they very flat or do they have a lot of bumps here and there? i was hoping for a large area like the runway at KSC

Most of it is flat ice sheet. Towards land (westward if looking at KSC straight down), is some hilly areas. Aparently it's snow/ice on land there.

It should be a great place to test your rocket cars... However, you need to test your wheels for greater then 60m/s at the airport first. The airplane wheels are the only ones that I know of that will go faster than 60 without popping.

Only one way to find out.....

(Poles are cool. (Literally.) Go visit them.)
And if you go to the north pole, keep your eyes peeled for some, well anomalous issues
